release.name: deployed/20221104_182939
release.body: ### Commit: 50df7267151e7a2051b3566ea6006e38af4d5332 hotfix/APPEALS-11111 (#17682) Resolves APPEALS-11111 Bug Discretion When using IDT to outcode decision documents the async job that uploads the decision documents to vbms are erroring out with changes made to the vbms external service ### Description Remove an issue found with the outcode functionality that was bleedover from the new IDT endpoint. Test Plan: [[Test UAT (External) - IDT - VBMS Service changes cause decision document upload errors](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11112)](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11112) *** ### Commit: e1667784551692b0012bcf6c74bc189bb84f40d2 Add VS Code Caseflow Workspace Settings (#17642) # Description Adds the following workspace configuration files for VS Code users: - settings.json (Helpful default settings) - extensions.json (Recommended extensions) - launch.json (Debugger settings) ## settings.json ```json { "editor.tabSize": 2, # Sets tabs to 2 spaces "editor.trimAutoWhitespace": true, # Trims whitespace added by the editor "eslint.packageManager": "yarn", # Sets default package manager to yarn "eslint.workingDirectories": [ # Allows ESLint to properly resolve import paths in Caseflow "./client" ], "files.insertFinalNewline": true, # Ensures the presence of a blank line at the end of each file "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true, # Removes trailing whitespace added by the user upon file save "git.autofetch": true, # Enables git fetch to be performed automatically on a timed interval } ``` ## extensions.json Extension recommendations can be found in the Extensions tab in the Recommendations pane. Any extensions already installed are omitted. ![Screenshot from 2022-10-27 22-42-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99351305/198477799-91cf4f23-0663-4d7a-9ac6-ec91700af0f3.png) Users will be asked if they'd like to install the recommended extensions: ![Screenshot from 2022-10-28 08-55-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99351305/198596583-30b1f120-1195-4995-9585-cb9a9963ea31.png) ## launch.json There are currently 4 debuggers configured within the `launch.json` file: Name|Purpose ---|--- Caseflow Backend|Launches the Caseflow Rails backend. Frontend must be run separately. Caseflow Backend with Email|Launches the Caseflow backend with the `WITH_EMAIL_TEST_SERVER` environmental variable enabled for testing Action Mailer messages locally. A [maildev](https://github.com/maildev/maildev) server will also be automatically launched at [http://localhost:1080/](http://localhost:1080/) where you'll be able to see emails sent from Caseflow. The container will be stopped whenever the debugger is stopped automatically, as well. See this [wiki article](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Testing-Action-Mailer-Messages-Locally) for more info. The frontend must be run separately. Caseflow Frontend|Launches the webpack-dev-server, and then opens a Chrome window to `localhost:3000` once it's done building the React app. The backend must be run separately. Caseflow Frontend and Backend|Combines "Caseflow Frontend" and "Caseflow Backend". A Rails server is spun up, and a Chrome window will open `localhost:3000` once the frontend builds. You can switch between the different debuggers using the dropdown at the top of the "Run and Debug" pane: You can press `F5` to launch whichever debugger you have selected from anywhere in VS Code for convenience. `SHIFT + F5` will stop any debugger that is currently running. In the "Run and Debug" pane you can set breakpoints in the code, watch variables, watch logs, see all variables currently in scope, view the call stack, and more. For more information on debugging in VS Code, [click here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging). **Backend:** **Frontend:** Note: The frontend debugger setup is seemingly a bit more finicky- depending on where breakpoints are placed, they may become unbound due to lifecycles of React components and other Javascript intricacies. You can use it in conjunction with the [debugger](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/debugger) statement by running it in the [Debug Console](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging#_debug-console-repl) for augmented results. # Testing The best way to test these settings is to take them out for a spin on development work you're already doing and seeing if they assist at all. You can pull these configs into another branch by running the following: ``` git checkout MattT/VS-Code-Extension-Recommendations -- .vscode ``` *** ### Commit: 4319f577fc651c04a0d005848f15fe6803472d36 FY23Q1.2 Production Deployment (#17674) Resolves APPEALS-9215 AND APPEALS-9207 BUSINESS IMPACT APPEALS-9215 As an IDT user, I need the IDT to include the suffix of the appellant, if it exists in BGS, so that IDT decisions and correspondence contains the appellant's full name. APPEALS-9207 As a Board IDT letter creator user, I want to be able to upload letters from the IDT to the efolder when the Veteran does not have a past or present appeal in the same way I can when the Veteran does have a past or present appeal. Testing Plan APPEALS-9207 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10280 APPEALS-9215 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10222 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10224

issue.title: feature/APPEALS-55 Ability to view notifications sent to Veteran in Caseflow
issue.body:
Resolves ASR 214

### Business Impact
Improves ability to electronically communicate with Veterans on the status of their appeals and reduces inquiries to Board's customer service line and email. Supports ability to notify Vets & reps of changes in appeal status.

Resolves Epic APPEALS-55

### Description
As a Caseflow user, I need the ability to view VA Notify notifications so that I am aware of communications sent to the Veteran.

### Acceptance Criteria

1. If VA Notify notifications have been sent to the user, then a link appears on the Case Details screen for user to view case notifications
2. When "View case notifications" is selected a new browser tab opens containing a notification view
3. User is able to view the following information for each notification
4. Event Type 
5. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
6. Notification Date (Date & Time)
7. Default sorted newest to oldest 
8. User has the ability to sort the values of this column oldest to newest
9. Notification Type (email/text)
10. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
11. Status of notification
12. sent
13.  delivered
14. if text delivered indicates the carrier (i.e. AT&T, Verizon) received it (not necessarily received by the Veteran)
15. failed
16.  technical-failure
17. temporary-failure
18. permanent-failure
19. preferences-declined
20. status returned when Veteran has opted out of a notification type 
21. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
22. Record of recipient
23. recipient email address if notification type is email
24. recipient contact information if notification type is text 
25. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
26. Notification content (actual verbiage of notification)
27. If event redeliveries happen then the actual status is reflected and not the initial status provided (e.g., initial status = temporary-failure > updated to permanent-failure)

### Testing Plan
1. https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10826
2. https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11053
3. https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11054

### Text Execution

AFTER

issue.body:
Resolves #{github issue number}

### Description
Please explain the changes you made here.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Code compiles correctly

### Testing Plan
1. Go to ...

- [ ] For higher-risk changes: [Deploy the custom branch to UAT to test](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/appeals-deployment/wiki/Applications---Deploy-Custom-Branch-to-UAT)

### User Facing Changes
 - [ ] Screenshots of UI changes added to PR & Original Issue

 BEFORE|AFTER
 ---|---

### Code Documentation Updates
- [ ] Add or update code comments at the top of the class, module, and/or component.

### Storybook Story
*For Frontend (Presentationa) Components*
* [ ] Add a [Storybook](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Documenting-React-Components-with-Storybook) file alongside the component file (e.g. create `MyComponent.stories.js` alongside `MyComponent.jsx`)
* [ ] Give it a title that reflects the component's location within the overall Caseflow hierarchy
* [ ] Write a separate story (within the same file) for each discrete variation of the component

### Database Changes
*Only for Schema Changes*

* [ ] Add typical timestamps (`created_at`, `updated_at`) for new tables
* [ ] Update column comments; include a "PII" prefix to indicate definite or potential [PII data content](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/appeals-team/blob/master/caseflow-team/0-how-we-work/pii-handbook.md#what-is-pii)
* [ ] Have your migration classes inherit from `Caseflow::Migration`, especially when adding indexes (use `add_safe_index`) (see [Writing DB migrations](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Writing-DB-migrations))
* [ ] Verify that `migrate:rollback` works as desired ([`change` supported functions](https://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/active_record_migrations.html#using-the-change-method))
* [ ] Perform query profiling (eyeball Rails log, check bullet and fasterer output)
* [ ] Add appropriate indexes (especially for foreign keys, polymorphic columns, unique constraints, and Rails scopes)
* [ ] Run `make check-fks`; add any missing foreign keys or add to `config/initializers/immigrant.rb` (see [Record associations and Foreign Keys](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Record-associations-and-Foreign-Keys))
* [ ] Add `belongs_to` for associations to enable the [schema diagrams](https://department-of-veterans-affairs.github.io/caseflow/task_trees/schema/schema_diagrams) to be automatically updated
* [ ] Post this PR in #appeals-schema with a summary
* [ ] Document any non-obvious semantics or logic useful for interpreting database data at [Caseflow Data Model and Dictionary](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Caseflow-Data-Model-and-Dictionary)

### Integrations: Adding endpoints for external APIs
* [ ] Check that Caseflow's external API code for the endpoint matches the code in the relevant integration repo
  * [ ] Request: Service name, method name, input field names
  * [ ] Response: Check expected data structure
* [ ] Update Fakes
* [ ] Integrations impacting functionality are tested in Caseflow UAT

payload.description: Caseflow is a web application that enables the tracking and processing of appealed claims at the Board of Veterans' Appeals.
The scripts necessary for building content for `vets-website`

This app provides a SAML SP and a SAML IdP that allows it to proxy SAML requests from Okta, which VA.gov will use as an OpenID Connect provider, and ID.me which VA.gov currently uses a authentication service.

issue.title: HunJerBAH/APPEALS-4125- Reassign Issues to a Split Appeal
issue.body:
Resolves [APPEALS-4125](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-4125)

### Description
As a developer I need to assign issues to the original and new appeals so that issues are split between appeals

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Code compiles correctly
When clicking "Split Appeal" on the Review and Confirm page of Split Appeal Workflow form:

- [ ] Issues in the form's new issue list are assigned to the new appeal.

- [ ] Issues in the form not in the new issue list are maintained on the original appeal

- [ ] Issue assignments are wrapped in the same transaction as work done in [APPEALS-4156](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-4156) so if any step of splitting an appeal fails all changes are rolled back

### Testing Plan
1. Go to demo

Resolves APPEALS-8488

### Description
Added a notification table which shows all the notifications and information about it that were sent for an appeal

### Acceptance Criteria
[ ] - Text display: "Viewing <x> - <y> of <z> total"
[ ] - A navigation pane exists above and below the table on the right
[ ] - Event Column - filterable 
[ ] - Notification Date Column - filterable and sortable (ascending by default)
[ ] - Notification Type - filterable
[ ]  - Status - filterable

release.name: deployed/20221104_182939
release.body: ### Commit: 50df7267151e7a2051b3566ea6006e38af4d5332 hotfix/APPEALS-11111 (#17682) Resolves APPEALS-11111 Bug Discretion When using IDT to outcode decision documents the async job that uploads the decision documents to vbms are erroring out with changes made to the vbms external service ### Description Remove an issue found with the outcode functionality that was bleedover from the new IDT endpoint. Test Plan: [[Test UAT (External) - IDT - VBMS Service changes cause decision document upload errors](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11112)](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11112) *** ### Commit: e1667784551692b0012bcf6c74bc189bb84f40d2 Add VS Code Caseflow Workspace Settings (#17642) # Description Adds the following workspace configuration files for VS Code users: - settings.json (Helpful default settings) - extensions.json (Recommended extensions) - launch.json (Debugger settings) ## settings.json ```json { "editor.tabSize": 2, # Sets tabs to 2 spaces "editor.trimAutoWhitespace": true, # Trims whitespace added by the editor "eslint.packageManager": "yarn", # Sets default package manager to yarn "eslint.workingDirectories": [ # Allows ESLint to properly resolve import paths in Caseflow "./client" ], "files.insertFinalNewline": true, # Ensures the presence of a blank line at the end of each file "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true, # Removes trailing whitespace added by the user upon file save "git.autofetch": true, # Enables git fetch to be performed automatically on a timed interval } ``` ## extensions.json Extension recommendations can be found in the Extensions tab in the Recommendations pane. Any extensions already installed are omitted. ![Screenshot from 2022-10-27 22-42-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99351305/198477799-91cf4f23-0663-4d7a-9ac6-ec91700af0f3.png) Users will be asked if they'd like to install the recommended extensions: ![Screenshot from 2022-10-28 08-55-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99351305/198596583-30b1f120-1195-4995-9585-cb9a9963ea31.png) ## launch.json There are currently 4 debuggers configured within the `launch.json` file: Name|Purpose ---|--- Caseflow Backend|Launches the Caseflow Rails backend. Frontend must be run separately. Caseflow Backend with Email|Launches the Caseflow backend with the `WITH_EMAIL_TEST_SERVER` environmental variable enabled for testing Action Mailer messages locally. A [maildev](https://github.com/maildev/maildev) server will also be automatically launched at [http://localhost:1080/](http://localhost:1080/) where you'll be able to see emails sent from Caseflow. The container will be stopped whenever the debugger is stopped automatically, as well. See this [wiki article](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Testing-Action-Mailer-Messages-Locally) for more info. The frontend must be run separately. Caseflow Frontend|Launches the webpack-dev-server, and then opens a Chrome window to `localhost:3000` once it's done building the React app. The backend must be run separately. Caseflow Frontend and Backend|Combines "Caseflow Frontend" and "Caseflow Backend". A Rails server is spun up, and a Chrome window will open `localhost:3000` once the frontend builds. You can switch between the different debuggers using the dropdown at the top of the "Run and Debug" pane: You can press `F5` to launch whichever debugger you have selected from anywhere in VS Code for convenience. `SHIFT + F5` will stop any debugger that is currently running. In the "Run and Debug" pane you can set breakpoints in the code, watch variables, watch logs, see all variables currently in scope, view the call stack, and more. For more information on debugging in VS Code, [click here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging). **Backend:** **Frontend:** Note: The frontend debugger setup is seemingly a bit more finicky- depending on where breakpoints are placed, they may become unbound due to lifecycles of React components and other Javascript intricacies. You can use it in conjunction with the [debugger](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/debugger) statement by running it in the [Debug Console](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging#_debug-console-repl) for augmented results. # Testing The best way to test these settings is to take them out for a spin on development work you're already doing and seeing if they assist at all. You can pull these configs into another branch by running the following: ``` git checkout MattT/VS-Code-Extension-Recommendations -- .vscode ``` *** ### Commit: 4319f577fc651c04a0d005848f15fe6803472d36 FY23Q1.2 Production Deployment (#17674) Resolves APPEALS-9215 AND APPEALS-9207 BUSINESS IMPACT APPEALS-9215 As an IDT user, I need the IDT to include the suffix of the appellant, if it exists in BGS, so that IDT decisions and correspondence contains the appellant's full name. APPEALS-9207 As a Board IDT letter creator user, I want to be able to upload letters from the IDT to the efolder when the Veteran does not have a past or present appeal in the same way I can when the Veteran does have a past or present appeal. Testing Plan APPEALS-9207 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10280 APPEALS-9215 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10222 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10224

issue.title: feature/APPEALS-55 Ability to view notifications sent to Veteran in Caseflow
issue.body:
Resolves ASR 214

### Business Impact
Improves ability to electronically communicate with Veterans on the status of their appeals and reduces inquiries to Board's customer service line and email. Supports ability to notify Vets & reps of changes in appeal status.

Resolves Epic APPEALS-55

### Description
As a Caseflow user, I need the ability to view VA Notify notifications so that I am aware of communications sent to the Veteran.

### Acceptance Criteria

1. If VA Notify notifications have been sent to the user, then a link appears on the Case Details screen for user to view case notifications
2. When "View case notifications" is selected a new browser tab opens containing a notification view
3. User is able to view the following information for each notification
4. Event Type 
5. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
6. Notification Date (Date & Time)
7. Default sorted newest to oldest 
8. User has the ability to sort the values of this column oldest to newest
9. Notification Type (email/text)
10. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
11. Status of notification
12. sent
13.  delivered

17. temporary-failure
18. permanent-failure
19. preferences-declined

21. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
22. Record of recipient
23. recipient email address if notification type is email
24. recipient contact information if notification type is text 
25. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
26. Notification content (actual verbiage of notification)
27. If event redeliveries happen then the actual status is reflected and not the initial status provided (e.g., initial status = temporary-failure > updated to permanent-failure)

payload.description: Caseflow is a web application that enables the tracking and processing of appealed claims at the Board of Veterans' Appeals.
The scripts necessary for building content for `vets-website`

This app provides a SAML SP and a SAML IdP that allows it to proxy SAML requests from Okta, which VA.gov will use as an OpenID Connect provider, and ID.me which VA.gov currently uses a authentication service.

issue.title: HunJerBAH/APPEALS-4125- Reassign Issues to a Split Appeal
issue.body:
Resolves [APPEALS-4125](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-4125)

### Description
As a developer I need to assign issues to the original and new appeals so that issues are split between appeals

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Code compiles correctly
When clicking "Split Appeal" on the Review and Confirm page of Split Appeal Workflow form:

- [ ] Issues in the form's new issue list are assigned to the new appeal.

- [ ] Issues in the form not in the new issue list are maintained on the original appeal

- [ ] Issue assignments are wrapped in the same transaction as work done in [APPEALS-4156](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-4156) so if any step of splitting an appeal fails all changes are rolled back

### Testing Plan
1. Go to demo

release.name: deployed/20221104_182939
release.body: ### Commit: 50df7267151e7a2051b3566ea6006e38af4d5332 hotfix/APPEALS-11111 (#17682) Resolves APPEALS-11111 Bug Discretion When using IDT to outcode decision documents the async job that uploads the decision documents to vbms are erroring out with changes made to the vbms external service ### Description Remove an issue found with the outcode functionality that was bleedover from the new IDT endpoint. Test Plan: [[Test UAT (External) - IDT - VBMS Service changes cause decision document upload errors](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11112)](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11112) *** ### Commit: e1667784551692b0012bcf6c74bc189bb84f40d2 Add VS Code Caseflow Workspace Settings (#17642) # Description Adds the following workspace configuration files for VS Code users: - settings.json (Helpful default settings) - extensions.json (Recommended extensions) - launch.json (Debugger settings) ## settings.json ```json { "editor.tabSize": 2, # Sets tabs to 2 spaces "editor.trimAutoWhitespace": true, # Trims whitespace added by the editor "eslint.packageManager": "yarn", # Sets default package manager to yarn "eslint.workingDirectories": [ # Allows ESLint to properly resolve import paths in Caseflow "./client" ], "files.insertFinalNewline": true, # Ensures the presence of a blank line at the end of each file "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true, # Removes trailing whitespace added by the user upon file save "git.autofetch": true, # Enables git fetch to be performed automatically on a timed interval } ``` ## extensions.json Extension recommendations can be found in the Extensions tab in the Recommendations pane. Any extensions already installed are omitted. ![Screenshot from 2022-10-27 22-42-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99351305/198477799-91cf4f23-0663-4d7a-9ac6-ec91700af0f3.png) Users will be asked if they'd like to install the recommended extensions: ![Screenshot from 2022-10-28 08-55-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99351305/198596583-30b1f120-1195-4995-9585-cb9a9963ea31.png) ## launch.json There are currently 4 debuggers configured within the `launch.json` file: Name|Purpose ---|--- Caseflow Backend|Launches the Caseflow Rails backend. Frontend must be run separately. Caseflow Backend with Email|Launches the Caseflow backend with the `WITH_EMAIL_TEST_SERVER` environmental variable enabled for testing Action Mailer messages locally. A [maildev](https://github.com/maildev/maildev) server will also be automatically launched at [http://localhost:1080/](http://localhost:1080/) where you'll be able to see emails sent from Caseflow. The container will be stopped whenever the debugger is stopped automatically, as well. See this [wiki article](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/caseflow/wiki/Testing-Action-Mailer-Messages-Locally) for more info. The frontend must be run separately. Caseflow Frontend|Launches the webpack-dev-server, and then opens a Chrome window to `localhost:3000` once it's done building the React app. The backend must be run separately. Caseflow Frontend and Backend|Combines "Caseflow Frontend" and "Caseflow Backend". A Rails server is spun up, and a Chrome window will open `localhost:3000` once the frontend builds. You can switch between the different debuggers using the dropdown at the top of the "Run and Debug" pane: You can press `F5` to launch whichever debugger you have selected from anywhere in VS Code for convenience. `SHIFT + F5` will stop any debugger that is currently running. In the "Run and Debug" pane you can set breakpoints in the code, watch variables, watch logs, see all variables currently in scope, view the call stack, and more. For more information on debugging in VS Code, [click here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging). **Backend:** **Frontend:** Note: The frontend debugger setup is seemingly a bit more finicky- depending on where breakpoints are placed, they may become unbound due to lifecycles of React components and other Javascript intricacies. You can use it in conjunction with the [debugger](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/debugger) statement by running it in the [Debug Console](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging#_debug-console-repl) for augmented results. # Testing The best way to test these settings is to take them out for a spin on development work you're already doing and seeing if they assist at all. You can pull these configs into another branch by running the following: ``` git checkout MattT/VS-Code-Extension-Recommendations -- .vscode ``` *** ### Commit: 4319f577fc651c04a0d005848f15fe6803472d36 FY23Q1.2 Production Deployment (#17674) Resolves APPEALS-9215 AND APPEALS-9207 BUSINESS IMPACT APPEALS-9215 As an IDT user, I need the IDT to include the suffix of the appellant, if it exists in BGS, so that IDT decisions and correspondence contains the appellant's full name. APPEALS-9207 As a Board IDT letter creator user, I want to be able to upload letters from the IDT to the efolder when the Veteran does not have a past or present appeal in the same way I can when the Veteran does have a past or present appeal. Testing Plan APPEALS-9207 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10280 APPEALS-9215 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10222 https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10224

issue.title: feature/APPEALS-55 Ability to view notifications sent to Veteran in Caseflow
issue.body:
Resolves ASR 214

### Business Impact
Improves ability to electronically communicate with Veterans on the status of their appeals and reduces inquiries to Board's customer service line and email. Supports ability to notify Vets & reps of changes in appeal status.

Resolves Epic APPEALS-55

### Description
As a Caseflow user, I need the ability to view VA Notify notifications so that I am aware of communications sent to the Veteran.

### Acceptance Criteria

1. If VA Notify notifications have been sent to the user, then a link appears on the Case Details screen for user to view case notifications
2. When "View case notifications" is selected a new browser tab opens containing a notification view
3. User is able to view the following information for each notification
4. Event Type 
5. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
6. Notification Date (Date & Time)
7. Default sorted newest to oldest 
8. User has the ability to sort the values of this column oldest to newest
9. Notification Type (email/text)
10. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
11. Status of notification
12. sent
13.  delivered
14. if text delivered indicates the carrier (i.e. AT&T, Verizon) received it (not necessarily received by the Veteran)
15. failed
16.  technical-failure
17. temporary-failure
18. permanent-failure
19. preferences-declined
20. status returned when Veteran has opted out of a notification type 
21. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
22. Record of recipient
23. recipient email address if notification type is email
24. recipient contact information if notification type is text 
25. User has the ability to filter values of this column using checkbox selection
26. Notification content (actual verbiage of notification)
27. If event redeliveries happen then the actual status is reflected and not the initial status provided (e.g., initial status = temporary-failure > updated to permanent-failure)

### Testing Plan
1. https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-10826
2. https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11053
3. https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-11054

### Text Execution

### User Facing Changes

 BEFORE
 
![Screenshot 2022-10-31 120458](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65432922/199054183-8ca9ab05-fb83-4d22-a62e-cec4ed89eec3.png)

AFTER

![Screenshot 2022-10-31 121234](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65432922/199055835-c27f5061-3525-4b50-9cbb-cdc1ab6e7a7d.png)

payload.description: Caseflow is a web application that enables the tracking and processing of appealed claims at the Board of Veterans' Appeals.
The scripts necessary for building content for `vets-website`

This app provides a SAML SP and a SAML IdP that allows it to proxy SAML requests from Okta, which VA.gov will use as an OpenID Connect provider, and ID.me which VA.gov currently uses a authentication service.

issue.title: HunJerBAH/APPEALS-4125- Reassign Issues to a Split Appeal
issue.body:
Resolves [APPEALS-4125](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-4125)

### Description
As a developer I need to assign issues to the original and new appeals so that issues are split between appeals

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Code compiles correctly
When clicking "Split Appeal" on the Review and Confirm page of Split Appeal Workflow form:

- [ ] Issues in the form's new issue list are assigned to the new appeal.

- [ ] Issues in the form not in the new issue list are maintained on the original appeal

- [ ] Issue assignments are wrapped in the same transaction as work done in [APPEALS-4156](https://vajira.max.gov/browse/APPEALS-4156) so if any step of splitting an appeal fails all changes are rolled back

### Testing Plan
1. Go to demo

* [ ] Check that Caseflow's external API code for the endpoint matches the code in the relevant integration repo
  * [ ] Request: Service name, method name, input field names
  * [ ] Response: Check expected data structure
* [ ] Update Fakes
* [ ] Integrations impacting functionality are tested in Caseflow UAT
